# Source: https://fly.io/docs/litefs/speedrun/

\*)\]:mx-auto \[body\_:where(&\>\*)\]:max-w-2xl \[body:not(.toc)\_:where(&\>\*)\]:lg:mx-\[calc(50%-min(50%,35rem))\] \[body\_:where(&\>\*)\]:lg:max-w-3xl min-w-0 relative\"\>

# Speedrun: Add LiteFS to your app 

This guide will get your app up and running with LiteFS on Fly.io as fast as possible. If you run into any issues with this guide, or you'd like some more details or a slower pace, check out the [Getting Started doc](/docs/litefs/getting-started-fly) instead.

You can also take a look at [the docs for your framework](/docs/languages-and-frameworks) to see if LiteFS is supported by `fly launch`.

This guide assumes you already have a working `Dockerfile` for your app. If not, get that working (with regular sqlite), and then come back here!

## [](#lets-do-this)[Let's do this!] 

### [](#1-configure-litefs-yml)[1. Configure litefs.yml] 

Copy [the sample `litefs.yml` file](https://github.com/superfly/litefs-example/blob/main/fly-io-config/etc/litefs.yml) from the `litefs-example` repo, and make the following updates:

-   Update from `8081` in `proxy.target` to whatever port your app listens on
-   Update `exec[0].cmd` to the command that runs your app

### [](#2-update-your-dockerfile)[2. Update your Dockerfile] 

Install LiteFS dependencies:

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
# for alpine-based images
RUN apk add ca-certificates fuse3 sqlite
# or for debian/ubuntu-based images
RUN apt-get update -y && apt-get install -y ca-certificates fuse3 sqlite3
```

Copy in the LiteFS binary:

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
COPY --from=flyio/litefs:0.5 /usr/local/bin/litefs /usr/local/bin/litefs
```

Update the `ENTRYPOINT` (or `CMD`):

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
ENTRYPOINT litefs mount
```

### [](#3-set-up-amp-deploy-to-the-fly-platform)[3. Set up & deploy to the Fly Platform] 

Create a volume:

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
fly volumes create litefs --size 10
```

Create your app config, but don't deploy it (say no when it asks):

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
fly launch
```

Configure consul (this sets the `FLY_CONSUL_URL` secret for your app, which is required for LitefS leases):

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
fly consul attach
```

Update your `fly.toml` file to mount your volume:

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
[mounts]
  source = "litefs"
  destination = "/var/lib/litefs"
```

Deploy your app:

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
fly deploy
```

TADA! You (hopefully) now have an app running with LiteFS! If you're having trouble, you can ask for help in [the Fly community](https://community.fly.io).

### [](#4-add-some-replicas-in-other-regions)[4. Add some replicas in other regions] 

LiteFS isn't *super* useful if you're running only one node. So, add some more nodes in more regions!

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Wrap text ]

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) [ Copy to clipboard ]

``` highlight
# Add a clone in London
fly m clone --select --region lhr
# Add a clone in Sydney
fly m clone --select --region syd
```

## [](#next-steps)[Next steps] 

[Back up your LiteFS cluster](/docs/litefs/backup/).
